issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Im going to tag this in the WTF category.

I ran lots and lots of churn/stress over the last week on a largish cloud (all components separate and 65 NCs). On friday last week there was a period where access keys were no longer being found which resolved itself after around 4 minutes. Now volumes are unable to be created because create volume says it cant find the AZ, but describe AZs shows it. 

/me is puzzled

{noformat}
[root@scale-01-01-01 chef-repo]# euca-create-volume -s 1 -z one
euca-create-volume: error (InvalidZone.NotFound): The zone 'one' does not exist.
[root@scale-01-01-01 chef-repo]# euca-describe-availability-zones
AVAILABILITYZONE        one     available
[root@scale-01-01-01 chef-repo]# euca-describe-services | grep storage
SERVICE objectstorage           API_10.112.10.3 API_10.112.10.3.objectstorage   ENABLED         253     http://10.112.10.3:8773/services/objectstorage       arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.112.10.3:objectstorage:API_10.112.10.3.objectstorage/
SERVICE storage                 one             one-sc-1                ENABLED         253     http://10.112.10.5:8773/services/Storage    arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:storage:one-sc-1/
[root@scale-01-01-01 chef-repo]#
{noformat}
fields.summary: After long term churn/stress, no longer able to create volumes because AZ not found

comments.body:

http://sosreports.objectstorage.cloud.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/sosreport-euca-qa.10696-20150330123305-75a5.tar.xz

In the SC log I see messages like:

nt via endpoint: DefaultOutboundEndpoint{endpointUri=vm://RequestQueue, connector=VMConnector

n=INDIFFERENT, timeout=0}, deleteUnacceptedMessages=false, initialState=started, responseTimeout=10000, endpointEncoding=UTF-8, disableTransp
ortTransformer=false}. Message payload is of type: CreateStorageVolumeType
org.mule.api.transport.DispatchException: Queue 'RequestQueue' is full (max capacity: 1,024). Failed to route event via endpoint: DefaultOutb
oundEndpoint{endpointUri=vm://RequestQueue, connector=VMConnector
{
  name=internal-async
  lifecycle=start
  this=2f5db62
  numberOfConcurrentTransactedReceivers=4
  createMultipleTransactedReceivers=true
  connected=true
  supportedProtocols=[vm]
  serviceOverrides=<none>
}
,
{noformat}

SOS report from SC:

http://sosreports.objectstorage.cloud.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/sosreport-euca-qa.10696-20150330130622-8f27.tar.xz
Restarting the SC and the CLC brought things back to working order.
[~mmunn1], please start the initial investigation of this issue.
[~viglesias] The CLC  sos report is corrupt it is only 1kb, can you upload it again if you still have it?

We are seeing Transactions failing to complete and OutOfMemoryErrors with heapdumps on the Storage Controller as well as depletion of database connections due to the following error.
The timeout is preventing the VolumeInfo.attachmentTokens from being removed this inturn is preventing the VolumeInfo from being removed thus preventing the transaction from getting completed, causing memory and database connections to leak resulting in the out of memory errors and heap dump.

In the heapdump we are seeing over 14,000 instances of CollectionRemoveActions with a reference to VolumeInfo.attachmentTokens taking up over a gig in memory
!VolumeInfoHeap.PNG!
I believe we may be running into a JBoss/infinispan Issue https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=901162
Ugh... looks like that's not being slated for a fix anytime soon...
[~tjcramer] Yes and it has been around for a very long time, We will see if we can reproduce this issue it is very intermittent, we may have to code around it if possible.

If we can reproduce this issue we may be able to alleviate the problem buy adjusting settings in file ./clc/modules/postgresql/src/main/resources/eucalyptus_cache_infinispan.xml
in particular:
1) Concurrency level: Adjust this value according to the number of concurrent threads interacting with Infinispan.
2) lockAcquisitionTimeout: Maximum time to attempt a particular lock acquisition. Set this based on your application needs.
3) useLockStriping: If true, a pool of shared locks is maintained for all entries that need to be locked. Otherwise, a lock is created per entry in the cache. Lockstriping helps control memory footprint but may reduce concurrency in the system.
Currently the settings are as follows:
{code}
<infinispan xmlns="urn:infinispan:config:5.2" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:infinispan:config:5.2 http://infinispan.org/schemas/infinispan-config-5.2.xsd">
    <global>
        <transport
                clusterName="${com.eucalyptus.cache.cluster:eucalyptus-infinispan}">
            <properties>
                <property
                        name="configurationFile"
                        value="${com.eucalyptus.cache.jgroups:eucalyptus_cache_jgroups.xml}" />
            </properties>
        </transport>
    </global>

    <default>
        <locking
                isolationLevel="REPEATABLE_READ"
                lockAcquisitionTimeout="${com.eucalyptus.cache.lockTimeout:20000}"/>

        <transaction
                transactionMode="TRANSACTIONAL"
                lockingMode="OPTIMISTIC"
                autoCommit="true"
                useSynchronization="false"
                />

        <expiration
                wakeUpInterval="500"
                lifespan="${com.eucalyptus.cache.lifespan:1000}"/>

        <clustering
                mode="invalidation"/>
    </default>

    <namedCache name="timestamps">
        <locking 
                isolationLevel="READ_COMMITTED" 
                concurrencyLevel="1000"
                lockAcquisitionTimeout="${com.eucalyptus.cache.timestamps.lockTimeout:20000}" 
                useLockStriping="false"/>

        <eviction 
                strategy="NONE"/>

        <expiration
               wakeUpInterval="-1"
               lifespan="-1"
               />

        <clustering
                mode="replication"/>
      </namedCache>

</infinispan>
{code}
[~sjones] Any input on the eucalyptus_cache_infinispan.xml configuration file settings would be greatly appreciated.

In our latest stress test we are seeing  "Running very low on perm-gen memory in Java" in the cloud-fault.logs a couple of hours into the stress test, a couple of hours after that a transaction error is thrown and the database host is pruned as orphaned.  We are going to increase the perm-gen and retest.  The Infinispan errors may in fact be a red herring cased by the loss of database connections.

We increased the perm-gen memory to 1G on the UI,CLC and SC,  this has taken care of the OutOfMemoryErrors and access key issues. We are now seeing the error "Total Volume Size Limit Exceeded volume:". When we do euca-describe-volumes we only see 10 volumes of 1G each even though one.storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb is set to 100 GB. Looking in the database we see 90 volumes that to not show up in euca-describe-volumes 23 of these are in the "deleting" state and and 67 in the "available" state. Looking on the SC /dev/vg01 we see that all 67 missing volumes in the 'available' state are in fact there while all the missing volumes in the "deleting' state are in fact deleted. It appears that the database in not getting updated sometimes during volume creation and volume deletion under heavy load. We are seeing 'Error while committing the transaction' for both the creation and deletion of these volumes. We are creating and deleting volumes as about one every .9 seconds in the test and it appears that the database is getting overwhelmed, I am seeing the following error multiple times over the run as well. I will continue to investigate the database connection issues.
{code}
Thu Apr 9 01:34:02 2015 ERROR [DBResourceCheck:pool-22-thread-1] [com.eucalyptus.troubleshooting.checker.DBResourceCheck$DBChecker.run(DBResourceCheck.java):243] db resource check failed for database_events
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy122.hashCode(Unknown Source)
	at org.logicalcobwebs.proxool.ProxyConnection.getDelegateHashcode(ProxyConnection.java:471)

	at com.eucalyptus.troubleshooting.checker.DBResourceCheck$DBChecker.run(DBResourceCheck.java:224)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:304)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:293)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: No active databases in cluster database_events
	at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.SQLExceptionFactory.createException(SQLExceptionFactory.java:51)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.SQLExceptionFactory.createException(SQLExceptionFactory.java:35)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.invocation.InvokeOnOneInvocationStrategy.invoke(InvokeOnOneInvocationStrategy.java:73)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.invocation.InvokeOnAnyInvocationStrategy.invoke(InvokeOnAnyInvocationStrategy.java:101)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.invocation.InvocationStrategies.invoke(InvocationStrategies.java:35)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractInvocationHandler.invokeOnProxy(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:95)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractInvocationHandler.invoke(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:85)
	at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.ChildInvocationHandler.invoke(ChildInvocationHandler.java:44)
	... 13 more
{code}
[~viglesias] When you get the chance could you re-run the stress test against maint-4.1now that it has the fix for EUCA-10744.
[~viglesias] is this test running with CLOUD_OPTS="-XX:MaxPermSize=4000M"? if so where?

[~mmunn1] yes its been running since yesterday++: http://10.112.150.153/

CLC is 10.112.10.1

[~viglesias] Can we restart the test in a freshly environment?  I am seeing 62 volumes leftover in /dev/vg01 from april 20th before you upped the permgen. By fresh I mean new created database and empty /dev/vg01. Right now we are dealing with artifacts from previous runs.

Rerunning here: 
http://10.112.150.226/

CLC is the same at 10.112.10.1
No longer seeing this but I have opened EUCA-10781 to track a similar issue.
